page.title: 18Traffic On Whitchurch Lane
page.content: The road system consists of a network of country lanes on either side of the A37.One of these,Whitchurch Lane,has changed in the last twenty years from a quiet,narrow country lane to a busy suburban road.People who live on the modern housing estates use the road to commute to the centre of Bristol. Whitchurch Lane also provides a route from the industrial areas in South Bristol,including large enterprises such as 'Harveys' and 'The Imperial Group'at Hartcliffe,to the A37 road. Here are the results of a traffic survey taken on Tuesday 16th July 1985 in Whitchurch Lane. cars lorries vans buses 10.00-10.30 176 8 18 2 17.00-17.30 358 28 66 4 During the rush hour the traffic increases.There are no pedestrian crossings but there is a subway.
